alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Hanover; King William; King and Queen; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 4:57PM EDT until July 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, east central Virginia, eastern Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Hanover. In east central Virginia, King William, King and Queen and New Kent. In eastern Virginia, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex and Northumberland. In southeast Virginia, Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Kent, King William, West Point, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, King And Queen Court House, Deltaville, Talleysville, Lancaster, White Stone, Church View, Shacklefords, Jamaica, Glenns, Little Plymouth, Saluda, Hartfield, Tunstall, Mascot and Velma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; Hanover; King William; King and Queen; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland
